image.altText: Stephanie Trethewey, Tasmanian Australian of the Year for 2024

props.synopsis: An Australian of the Year finalist divested shares in an abattoir owned by herself and her husband in the wake of "animal welfare issues".

title.children: Australian of the Year finalist denounces 'crazy vegans' after divesting abattoir co-ownership to husband

image.altText: A picture of a baby on a table at a birthday party.

props.synopsis: Hobart mother Maddison Butler should be celebrating her son's first birthday. Instead she is honouring his short life.

title.children: Baby Khaylan is being remembered as a happy, cheeky baby. His mother never wants his memory to fade

image.altText: Two Australian Army MRH-90 Taipains in flight against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: The 45 Taipan MRH-90 aircraft were retired last year after a crash in Queensland that killed four Defence personnel during a training exercise.

title.children: Australia formally rejects request from Ukraine for troubled MRH-90 Taipan helicopter fleet

image.altText: A close up of a woamn wearing a headscarf staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: When Rajaa and Chandni's daughter went missing, they struggled to get help from police. Their experience is all too familiar in India as the country grapples with mounting sexual assault cases.

title.children: Chandni's daughter was only nine when she was killed. She is demanding justice for her little girl

image.altText: A man wearing a blue vest that says UN on it.

props.synopsis: The head of the United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees, Philippe Lazzarini, labels accusations against it a "smear campaign" but commissions an independent review nonetheless.

title.children: UN agency launches review following allegations it has been exploited by Hamas

image.altText: Getty Images: Kelly Defina

props.synopsis: Third seed Elena Rybakina headlines a list of seeded women knocked out in the second round of the Australian Open, falling to her former doubles partner in a historic match.

title.children: Historic tie breaker the highlight on day of upsets which blows women's draw wide open

image.altText: Woman in sportswear holds large silver trophy and smiles humbly toward crowd

props.synopsis: The tennis is world-class but when it comes to the Australian Open, let's face it — it's not just about the sport. Here are five moments from past Australian Opens we'll never forget.

title.children: Epic clashes, tales of sportsmanship and home-soil heroes: Relive Australian Opens past

image.altText: A woman looking at a letter.

props.synopsis: Since rebates for psychology sessions were halved a year ago, the cost of living crisis has forced Australians to compromise and even forego critical mental health care.

title.children: Patients struggle to afford psychology appointments after government halves subsidies

image.altText: Cars queue for fuel

props.synopsis: The Department of Fire and Emergency services has warned residents across the Goldfields and Wheatbelt to prepare for ongoing blackouts over the next seven days.

title.children: No power, no fuel, no alcohol as DFES warns regional WA blackouts could last up to a week

image.altText: A man wearing a blue jacket and a white hard hat uses a metal rod to point at the rock wall of an underground mine shaft.

props.synopsis: Swifts Creek in Victoria's high country lost its major industry when native logging ended, but some community members hope gold mining could help replace lost jobs.

title.children: Could gold be the economic lifeline this former timber town is looking for?

image.altText: Woman with respiratory illness, blowing her nose into handkerchief.

props.synopsis: Respiratory syncytial virus gets noses running, but in the last few days it's also got tongues wagging — ever since it was revealed a new vaccine would soon be made available in Australia.

title.children: A new vaccine is about to launch against RSV — here's what we know

image.altText: A Uvalde police officer watches as family and friends of those killed and injured in the school shootings protest.

props.synopsis: The report faults law enforcement officers in Uvalde for waiting more than an hour to breach the classroom where the 18-year-old gunman was holed up with students and staff.

title.children: US Justice Department report finds law enforcement 'failure' during Uvalde school shooting

image.altText: A man in a cowboy hat looks seriously into the middle distance.

props.synopsis: Majura Valley farmers say they've been in a constant battle for certainty regarding their properties in Canberra's agricultural heartland.

title.children: Farmers say livelihoods are under threat due to the ACT government's failure to deliver on lease promise

image.altText: A children's playground is closed off with gates with a notice attached to the gates.

props.synopsis: It's also been revealed that the New South Wales transport authority was emailed about asbestos in the Rozelle Parklands seven days before testing the site.

title.children: 'It is an emergency': More than 10 tonnes of asbestos waste suspected to be in Rozelle Parklands

image.altText: Houses on a hill.

props.synopsis: Queensland's peak real estate body wants the the longstanding land tax threshold to increase with inflation, but the government warns the move would cost the budget $200 million per year.

title.children: Thousands more properties fall under Queensland's land tax regime as values rise

image.altText: People gather near rubble in the aftermath of Pakistan's military strike on an Iranian village.

props.synopsis: Pakistan has launched air strikes on Iran, allegedly targeting separatist militants and killing at least nine people, in an attack that has further raised tensions in the region.

title.children: Nine people killed as Pakistan launches retaliatory air strikes against Iran

image.altText: Travis Head looks as a ball passes his head

props.synopsis: Australia is on the cusp of victory thanks to a remarkable new ball spell from Josh Hazlewood and a gritty century from Travis Head. Here's the five quick hits from day two of the first Test from Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Five quick hits — Travis's ton and Hazlewood's ridiculous spell on day two

image.altText: Writer, blogger Yang Hengjun

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong vows to continue to advocate for Australian writer Yang Hengjun, who has now been detained in China for five years on suspicion of spying.

title.children: Wong says Australia won't give up on Dr Yang Hengjun's release, five years after his imprisonment in China

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf  smiling

props.synopsis: Antoinette Lattouf claims she was unlawfully dismissed by the public broadcaster over an Instagram post when she was terminated three days into a five-day contract to present on ABC Radio Sydney.

title.children: Former ABC presenter Antoinette Lattouf vows to fight unlawful termination case 'as long as it takes'

image.altText: Two hands hold a little penguin amongst shrubs.

props.synopsis: Researchers say they have found dangerous chemicals in little penguin habitat and populations around Tasmania.

title.children: 'I found PFAS in all except one': Toxic chemicals found in little penguin colonies around Tasmania

image.altText: Two horses rearing and fighting with bushland in the background.

props.synopsis: A "wow moment" video of a fiery exchange between brumbies in Kosciuszko National Park gains popularity amid continued efforts to reduce their population.

title.children: Award-winning photographer captures rare footage of brumby clash as culling debate continues

image.altText: Photo of King Charles looking serious

props.synopsis: The 75-year-old monarch is facing one of the most common prostate problems in older men. Here's what you need to know about the condition.

title.children: King Charles's enlarged prostate is one of the most common health issues for Australian men

image.altText: A screenshot of grainy CCTV vision showing dozens of people standing insight a tight space

props.synopsis: Confronting CCTV has captured a prison guard assaulting a handcuffed, 16-year-old inside a notorious youth jail in Perth.

title.children: 'You know there's a camera up there?': CCTV assault on handcuffed teen reveals youth justice problems

image.altText: A man robs a store wearing a clown mask

props.synopsis: An armed man has robbed a store in Holland Park in Brisbane's south wearing a clown mask and brandishing what appears to be a gun before fleeing with a sum of cash.

title.children: Video shows armed man in clown mask robbing Brisbane business, fleeing with cash

image.altText: Two cars parked next to each other both have all their windows smashed

props.synopsis: Residents of an apartment complex in the heart of Alice Springs say crime is the worst they've ever seen it and are calling for the government to do more to keep them safe.

title.children: 'Deplorable act': Alice Springs workers in shock after mass car vandalism in apartment block

image.altText: The silhouette of young people on the street at night

props.synopsis: A new space to house young people who have been roaming the streets of the Kimberley town at night will soon open with the aim of keeping them safe while easing pressure on police.

title.children: Broome community promised overnight space for at-risk youth after police take 800 kids off the streets

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses, blond beard, chain around neck, smiles.

props.synopsis: A Toowoomba man will face trial at a yet-to-be-set date in the Supreme Court over an alleged murder in 2022.

title.children: Man accused of hit-and-run murder ordered to stand trial despite key witness's refusal to testify

image.altText: An image of two Black Cormorants sitting on a piece of wood in water.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading ecologists says climate change should be specifically mentioned for the first time in revamped threatened species legislation, due to be released by the Albanese government in 2024.

title.children: 'Australians don't want more extinctions': Leading ecologist warns about climate change impact on biodiversity

props.synopsis: The Invasive Species Council says the venomous ants could "take advantage" of heavy rainfall in south-east Queensland and move into new areas.

title.children: Footage of fire ants forming raft in water sparks concerns floods will help pest spread

image.altText: Aerial vision of an algae bloom at a Perth beach

props.synopsis: An algal bloom has closed a popular Perth beach, with the Water Corporation saying concerns the outbreak is linked with treated wastewater pouring into the ocean are unfounded.

title.children: Water Corp shuts down sewage contamination fears as algal bloom closes Perth beach
